title: Val do Sosego 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit, banana and citrus aromas are flat and not fully convincing. This is narrow in feel, with bland stone-fruit flavors. The finish follows the palate, meaning it's good enough but unremarkable.

title: Vallobera 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Grainy oak and earthy red-fruit aromas lead to a hard, tannic palate. Basic plum and cherry flavors finish rough and highly tannic, with savory notes.

title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: This is a bold rich wine—perhaps too rich. It has dense black fruits that go with the dark chocolate and licorice flavors. It still has young tannins and acidity and these need to soften. Drink this rich wine from late 2017.

title: A. de Luze et Fils 2015 Fleur de Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This aromatic herbal Sauvignon is crisp while also showing the ripe fruit of the vintage. It is full of citrus and melon fruits, tangy acidity and a bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Barba 2015 Colle Morino  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of mature berry, cooking spice and a whiff of violet lead the nose on this easygoing wine. The simple palate offers dark cherry and a suggestion of almond alongside loose fleeting tannins. Drink soon.

title: Barone Cornacchia 2014  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Dark-skinned berry, moist earth and blue flower aromas lead the nose on this. The lean straightforward palate offers raw cherry and a hint of clove alongside bracing acidity and fleeting tannins.

title: Bodegas Cerrosol 2015 Monte Palma Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Although this smells a bit oily, gritty and pyrazinic—an indication that it's living on borrowed time—at the moment this SB is still in fairly good shape. Pithy grapefruit flavors finish plump and citrusy. Drink immediately.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Too alcoholic for its own good, the wine is full bodied and heavy. It has tannins, superripe black fruits while missing structure and acidity. It is developing fast and will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: La Fiera 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Purple flower and mature dark berry aromas lift out of the glass. Extremely simple and diluted, the palate offers suggestions of morello cherry, a hint of spice and loose-knit fleeting tannins.

title: Oak Knoll 2011 Goose Ridge Vineyard Barbera (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of red fruit, game and vanilla are followed by quite tart puckering fruit flavors. It needs food to counteract the screaming acid.

title: Gorrebusto 2015  Rioja
description: Candied berry aromas lack crispness. This feels hard, with little give and depth to the palate. Burnt toasted berry flavors are hot and fall off on a clumsy finish.

title: 2Plank 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This superripe, late-harvest style of wine smells like raisins and dried plums. It tastes so fruity and ripe that it's sweet, with a full body to match. It would be best as a dessert wine.

title: Angove 2014 Family Crest Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
description: Brassy in color and woody in aroma, this Chardonnay is a pleasant enough drink, offering ample weight and modest pear and citrus flavors. Drink it through 2017.

title: Barba 2015 Vasari  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: A whiff of cellar floor and powdered sage lead the nose. The simple diluted palate offers dried black cherry and an earthy note alongside fleeting tannins.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Canchales Vino Joven  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery raspberry and plum aromas are decent. This feels crisp and abrasive on the surface, but sort of empty in the middle. Lean snappy plum and raspberry flavors end with scratchy tannins and a medicinal aftertaste.

title: Trapiche 2014 Oak Cask Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Grassy stalky berry aromas lean towards green. This feels grippy, while spicy herbal berry flavors stay the course and finish with minty green notes on top of basic plum and berry.

title: Umani Ronchi 2015 Podere  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: This easygoing, informal wine offers subdued aromas suggesting cassis, raisin and a note of dried herb. The simple palate shows mature plum and a hint of clove alongside fleeting tannins.

title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
description: This pink wine smells of red-apple skins. The palate is low on acidity but not entirely dull. Dry briny lightly bitter flavors don't show a lot of fruit, while this is pulpy on the finish.

title: South Stage 2012 Carmenère (Rogue Valley)
description: This shows the tannic chewy, vegetal nature of the grape, without off-setting it with other flavors. One-third new French oak has made little impact, and the wine is rough and astringent through a quick finish.

title: Château Kalon Nodoz 2012 Carpe Diem  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: The wine is lean for the vintage, tight and with an austere structure. Its tannins and juicy red fruits are in the background. The aftertaste is dry and firm.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: A fruity wine with soft tannins that is ready to drink. It has banana, red cherry and light spice flavors, finished off with attractive acidity.

title: La Catrina NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Most of the action is on the outside of this gaudy bottle. However, this light and slightly sweet wine has appley, floral flavors and a soft, easy texture.

title: Quinta da Padrela 2013 Premium Red (Douro)
description: The tannins are firm, still controlling the black fruits in this wine. It is concentrated, with considerable extraction giving a dry wine with a hard edge. The red-berry flavors are lost.

title: Valori 2014  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Easygoing and enjoyable, this has aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, violet and an earthy whiff of truffle. The juicy simple palate offers black cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside supple tannins. Drink soon.

title: Venta Morales 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Heavy oak aromas sit atop wiry plum and spice scents. This feels tannic and tough, with up-front oak and herbal berry flavors. A dry tannic, spicy finish features palpable oak that tastes forced and like plastic.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Tinto Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine is ripe with red fruits and soft tannins. It is smooth, packed with red-berry flavors lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.

title: Castorani 2014 Le Paranze  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of plum, violet and a whiff of spice emerge on this extremely simple red. The short diluted palate suggests red cherry and a hint of vanilla alongside frail tannins.

title: Bodegas Isidro Milagro 2015 SPÑ Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Prickly berry aromas include notes of both candied raspberry and cinnamon. This feels a bit clunky and sticky, with sugary berry flavors and a slightly cloying finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Campos de Risca 2013 Estate Wine Organic Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Dusty aromas of desert brush, oak, blueberry, animal hide and green herbs are strained. This feels raw and choppy, while reedy herbal red-fruit flavors finish with a note of raisin. This Monastrell (with 10% Syrah) is okay but all over the map.

title: Casa Montes 2015 Ampakama Viognier (San Juan)
description: Briny, cidery aromas are a touch stale. This has a basic citrusy mouthfeel along with flavors of orange and tangerine that turn mildly bitter and pithy on the finish.
